subject: Re: Insurer Feedback - Travel
preview: Thank Joel,  Let us know if you were able to update from system time to local time of the date picker?  Thanks  David

full_threads.body:
Thank Joel,

Let us know if you were able to update from system time to local time of the date picker?

Thanks

David

Hi David,

Thanks David, All good now, we are now able to submit and redirected to the next step.

Just resubmitted the quote using same details as you did and it now passes using 20/10/2005.

Let me know if you were now able to proceed using the details that were blocked before.

Thanks

David

Hi Joel, Heath,

Think we have figured it out.

The error you are seeing is due to our Insurer using UTC to calculate DOB (when you submit a request ultimately we call the insurer for the rate and if the customer is under 18 it blocks it).

At the moment it is still just the 19th in UTC time so technically the rating engine sees the customer as 17 still. In 5 minutes, I think if you input the same DOB it will then proceed. I am seeing the same error as you when inputting 20/10/2005.

On a separate note

It looks like your DOB validation is using AEDT (that's fine to continue to use that) but the trip start date calendar is using the computer/device time to decide what the first start date it should show. I was able to adjust my computer earlier today to 12th October and could select the 12th October as a start date. If you could update the calendar to use local time (same as your DOB validation) rather than system time that would be great.

We will speak to the insurer to see what they can do on their side regarding using UTC as the anchor time for DOB for rating purposes.

Best regards,

David

David Barnes

Chief Product Officer

Our insurer has reported that the dob is still causing them issues with the under 18 validation. They were testing in Aus and on the 19th in the morning they were still getting the validation error on DOB.



Best regards,

David

David Barnes

Chief Product Officer

David

Hi David,

We have updated the datepicker to AU date.

Regarding button being clicked, we have fixed this one and disabled the button once it is submitted.

Thanks Joel,

I can see the date of birth validation is resolved. But still seem to be having an issue with the date picker allowing me to select the 17th when it is the 18th now in Aus. Can you update the date picker to use the local time too.

That seems to be fixed now, thanks Joel.

On a side note I did notice that the submit button becomes active again in the short interval between the API response being consumed by the Wolf site and the user being redirected to Stella.

This does not appear to affect the user journey but conceivable that when running on the faster prod environment the user could double tap by mistake and we'd have 2 quotes submitted to our API.

Shane

Hi David, Sure, Can you please try now? We were working on some stuff for that one. https://staging-stellainsurance-dec2022.kinsta.cloud/get-a-travel-insurance-quote/ You can now check the validation for DOB. Thanks, Joel Maligalig support@wolfiq.com.au Are you impressed with our service? Click here to review us on Google! Your website Care Plan includes Developer Time, which is used to complete your requests. The included time varies across our plans:
  • Lite Care Plans - 15mins/month
  • Pro Care Plans - 2hrs/month
  • Expert Care Plan - 5hrs/month
If you require extra Developer Time to complete this request, it will be billed at $109/hr inc GST. Please let us know if you would like a quote before we commence your request.

Hi Joel

The quick quote tool is now blocked?

Any ideas? We are completing final testing so need it unblocked ASAP

David

Hi Joel

I saw that a minute ago.

For this product, we would need to fix the timezone to local Aus time regardless of where the customer is in the world?

Best regards,

David

Hi David,

Confirming we have updated the site. 13 and 14 are now done.

As a test, you will see a date at the top of "Where are you travelling to?" (This will be removed), Regarding the date validation we are using the timezone based on where the client is. Can you test it from your end and see if you are seeing the correct timezone?

Hi Joel,

Have added the comment below comment to number 10 for your review

- Our insurer was testing this earlier today and wasn't getting the validation message on under 18 using the input of 16/10/2005.

Later in the afternoon they retested and it worked. His first attempt was at 08:23 AEST, 23:23 BST, 22.23 UTC. I wonder is the the validation rule using UTC as today's date?

Have added no 13 and 14 also.

Best regards,

David

David Barnes

Chief Product Officer
